== May 2006 arrest and outcry ==
== May 2006 arrest and outcry ==
â
+
[[File:Alaa Abd El-Fatah using his laptop.jpg|thumb|upright|A picture a Alaa that was used by activists demanding his release.]]
On Sunday, May 7, 2006, he was arrested during a peaceful protest which spoke out on behalf of an independent Egyptian judiciary. His arrest, along with that of several other bloggers and democracy activists, spurred a protest by others around the world, some of whom created a new blog, "''Free Alaa''",<ref>[http://freealaa.blogspot.com/ Freealaa blog]</ref> devoted to calling for his release from jail.<ref>[http://www.sandmonkey.org/2006/05/09/help-us-free-alaa/ Sandmonkey blog]</ref>
On Sunday, May 7, 2006, he was arrested during a peaceful protest which spoke out on behalf of an independent Egyptian judiciary. His arrest, along with that of several other bloggers and democracy activists, spurred a protest by others around the world, some of whom created a new blog, "''Free Alaa''",<ref>[http://freealaa.blogspot.com/ Freealaa blog]</ref> devoted to calling for his release from jail.<ref>[http://www.sandmonkey.org/2006/05/09/help-us-free-alaa/ Sandmonkey blog]</ref>
==45 days in jail ==
==45 days in jail ==
  +
Alaa Abd El-Fatah was released on Tuesday June 20, 2006, after spending 45 days in jail. His wife Manal was quoted as saying in media reports (The Independent, UK): "There's no going back now, we'll definitely be continuing our activities."
Alaa Abd El-Fatah was released on Tuesday June 20, 2006, after spending 45 days in jail. His wife Manal was quoted as saying in media reports (The Independent, UK): "There's no going back now, we'll definitely be continuing our activities."
